result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Hernandez Fernandez

records.addlTxt:
2:07 PM (21CF386/22CF12) Interpreter Elizabeth M Barrera appears and is sworn in. Defendant Jesus Hernandez Fernandez in court.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Jesus Hernandez Fernandez.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews plea agreement, reviews rights, charges, and penalties. As to count 3 of the amended information in 2021CF386, def enters a plea of guilty. Court makes findings, accepts plea, and enters conviction. Counts 1 and 4 Case 22CF386 and case 22CF12 are DRI. Count 2 in case 2021CF386 is dismissed.

Court imposes the following sentence:
Sentence withheld
Probation for a period of 24 months with the following conditions:
45 days in DCJ w h&t to commence on 9-2-22
Maintain absolute sobriety
Not be present in any bars, taverns, liquor stores
24 months license revocation w/ IID
$600 fine plus driver improvement surcharge
AODA assessment and follow through
Not to operate vehicle without valid license
DNA + costs
and Stipulation for Cont. of P&S
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:33AM (21CF386/22CF12) Defendant Jesus Hernandez Fernandez in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Jesus Hernandez Fernandez.  Interpreter Laura Salcido Blancas appeared by phone. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:38 AM Defendant Jesus Hernandez Fernandez in court with interp Barrera and attorney Katherine Marie Findley.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Atty Findley requesting new date;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

01:16 PM Defendant Jesus Hernandez Fernandez in court, in custody w/Interp. from Swits Sara St. John with attorney Alyssa F. George (will appoint; has Atty. Findley in another case); Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $2,000 Cash bond; Atty. George response; Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 2/17/22 at 8:30am in Br. 4; Court sets $500.00 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
